[["$r","MaxWidth","last",{"children":[["$r","Intro",null,{"children":["$r","p",null,{"children":["ReactUnity works with a collection of packages on the Javascript side. These are ",["$r","code",null,{"children":"@reactunity/renderer"}]," and ",["$r","code",null,{"children":"@reactunity/scripts"}],"."]}]}],"
",["$r","h2",null,{"id":"renderer","children":"Renderer"}],"
",["$r","p",null,{"children":[["$r","code",null,{"children":"@reactunity/renderer"}]," is an npm package that handles the rendering login of the React virtual DOM. Without going into details, it is much alike ",["$r","code",null,{"children":"react-dom"}]," in what it does."]}],"
",["$r","pre",null,{"children":["$r","code",null,{"className":"language-js","children":"import { render } from '@reactunity/renderer';

render(<view>Hello world!</view>)
"}]}],"
",["$r","p",null,{"children":"In addition to its rendering functionality, it also includes Typescript types and utilities to improve development experience."}],"
",["$r","h2",null,{"id":"scripts","children":"Scripts"}],"
",["$r","p",null,{"children":[["$r","code",null,{"children":"@reactunity/scripts"}]," is the collection of npm scripts and Webpack configuration that can be used to easily build and run ReactUnity projects. It is an npm package and it should be included in ",["$r","code",null,{"children":"devDependencies"}],"."]}],"
",["$r","h3",null,{"id":"starting","children":"Starting"}],"
",["$r","TerminalBlock",null,{"children":["$r","p",null,{"children":"react-unity-scripts start"}]}],"
",["$r","p",null,{"children":"Starts the Webpack Dev Server with Fast Refresh configuration."}],"
",["$r","h3",null,{"id":"building","children":"Building"}],"
",["$r","TerminalBlock",null,{"children":["$r","p",null,{"children":"react-unity-scripts build"}]}],"
",["$r","p",null,{"children":"Builds the project into statical files to be production-ready."}]]}]]
